column5: Does anyone know what is the best GPS mapping software for Lake Nipigon? Lakemaster or Navionics?
Outside of Woods/Rainy, Lakemaster has no coverage of Canada that I know of. See for yourself:http://www.humminbird.com/Freshwater...ter/?p=1&ps=24
It's not charted. Best bet would to use auto chart live or similar program.

There are no chips for the lake. We fish the northern part and at first it was a little hairy, but you create safe tracks and save them. The lake just shows up as a blue blob on your Navionics screen and most islands are not shown even crudely. Depending where you fish you can get some old paper maps (and laminate them) which show contours, although out of date. But at least you will know where the shoals/reefs are and general depths as you are motoring in those areas.
